reviews.review_msg: Totally awesome proffs. The one's that leave reviews about favourites are just choking on sour grapes. He doesn't play favourites, he just appreciates it when students take initiative and seek his help on a problem - shows him they are trying.  Also, really entertaining and engaging. The classes are rather hard, but forensics/osteo aren't easy.

Uncommunicative when it comes to logistics and business of class.Doesn't provide evaluation criteria or learning goals of class.He's quiet and mumbles during lectures. Not very helpful.You're on your own. Hopefully you have a good T.A.The one this semester is very bad and it seems wants you to do poorly.Take another prof. for osteology if you can.
Ive taken 3 archaeology courses with Brian, didnt like him for the lower level class at all. But for the upper level stuff the guy is a champ prof. Encourages his class to think outside the box.

Lectures are very low-energy, if you raise your hand with a question he'll never see it, you have to verbally interrupt because he doesn't look up when he talks. It's not very engaging. If you make the effort to get to know him I think he is better, but that seems to be hard to do. He is definitely very knowledgeable about PNW archaeology.

This class is a 5 credit course, and you can definitely tell. He doesn't give you a lot of information for the quizzes and they are really tough. Assignments are okay but also graded quite hard. A very dry course. He is not the friendliest and not very approachable.

Bob is an amazing prof! I loved the set up of his lectures and the labs were pretty much crystal clear, you can tell her has been teaching a long time but thats what makes his classes so structured and organized.

Anyone who says anything bad about bob isn't in his class to learn. The amount of work bob does a semester could not be done by any other prof except for him. Yes.. he looks like he hasn't slept in 10 days all the time, but just shut up and listen to him and you'll learn he has a lot of important information you can learn.

This course is a good elective to take esepcially if you take it with Bob.  Although readings are assigned, they are only informative and they almost never show up on the quizes.  You have 5 quizes all are lab based with the exception of the first one.  Labs are a time consuming but easy to get a good mark on if you put in the time.

I don't know why people dislike him so much.  He's super nice, relatively easy marker and tries to make the best of the material he is teaching. 372 is lets face it, not the most exciting material to learn about.  I would take another class with him!

Wow, what a tool!  this man was so freaking boring, if you have to take a class with him, (and I mean HAVE to) have at least 3 coffees before class or you won't make it!  Oh and he looks like a potato.
Well, first of all, he teaches arch, not anth. Second, he is a great prof, and if you're bored with him, he's probably bored with you, too.

He is by far the most BORING prof I have ever had.  His lectures are equal to watching paint dry.  He told our class that he knows our writing so if we write any bad comments on his evaluation he'll know who it was....Is that fair or allowed?  Overall, taking a class with bob muir is like having a pigeon teach the class!  NO Thanks!
